section.title: Intended Audience
section.p: This Customization Guide is meant to help integrators or system admins who are looking for information about integrating and customizing .
For those looking for information about how to use the application, see the Oxygen XML Web Author User Guide.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: One of the main benefits of is that it can be integrated into your existing content ecosystem and allows anyone in your organization to access your content from anywhere they have an internet connection. is highly versatile and can be customized to work with any XML vocabulary and any file repository system. It uses the same extension points, frameworks, options, and plugins as the standalone version of Oxygen XML Editor/Author.

Depending on your requirements, you may need to integrate with several components. The complexity of your integration can range from a simple configuration to developing custom extensions using the API.

section.title: Integration with File Storage Systems
section.p: If you want your content contributors to be able to open and save files, you need to integrate with your file storage system. For example, it can be integrated into a CMS or a versioning control system.

section.title: Integration with a User Management System
section.p: You can also integrate with a user management system. This allows you to manage permissions and authentication, display the name of the user in comments and tracked changes, or customize the interface according to a user profile.

section.title: Integration in a CMS or Another Web Application
section.p: Web Author can be integrated as an embedded XML editor within your Content Management System or in another web application. You can even customize the Web Author interface by using the JavaScript API.

section.title: Integrate Web Author in Your Workflow
section.p: can be configured to launch from an embedded link (for example, a link that appears in a web page, email message, or published output). You can also control the workflow by embedding a custom action in the toolbar or contextual menu (for example, an action to check a file in/out or mark a reviewed file as being resolved).

section.title: Customizing Web Author for Your Content
section.p: There are various ways that you can customize Web Author to adhere to your requirements for structured content:

ul.li: Web Author supports any XML schema in any schema language. It also offers built-in support for DITA, DocBook, TEI and XHTML.
Customized frameworks can be reused interchangeably between Oxygen XML Editor/Author and .
supports inline form controls to make it easier to edit complex XML structures.
You can impose business rules through Schematron validation and quick fixes. For more information, see the Schematron Quick Fixes (SQF) section in the Oxygen XML Editor User Manual.
includes an automatic spell checking feature and you can customize the words that are detected by adding custom dictionaries. Web Author also supports 3rd-party solutions for checking grammar.

While customizing a framework in Oxygen XML Editor/Author, you can create your own custom document templates and once the framework is uploaded to Web Author, users will have access to the templates when creating a new document.
can be customized with a variety of plugin types or using the Java or JavaScript API.
You have the ability to customize various options that are shared between and Oxygen XML Editor/Author. This allows you to configure a consistent editing experience for all users.
